title: Carcinoma Ex Pleomorphic Adenoma of the Palate Composed of Invasive Micropapillary Salivary Duct Carcinoma and Adenoid Cystic Carcinoma Components
patient: A 74-year-old white woman presented with a painful swelling in the right hard and soft palates associated with enlarged homolateral regional lymph nodes. A malignant salivary gland tumor was suspected and the patient underwent resection of the mass with right radical neck dissection. Tumor-free margins were confirmed by microscopic examination of intraoperative frozen sections.
